page.title: 09ARABLE FARMING
page.content: Including the land for buildings and drives the larger farm has 990 acres. The majority of the land is loam overlying chalk.Wheat and Barley are the most profitable crops for soil type constituting a near monoculture There are 220 acres of barley of malting quality produced for lager; 260 of winter wheat for feed and 260 of spring barley.Quality is regarded as more important than yield. There are 3 workers instead of the former 27 helping the farmer who keeps 1 combine harvester,3 large tractors and 1 small one.The combine harvester present cost Â£80,000,lasts about 6 years and the tractors about Â£21,000 each,last about 5 years.Â£145,000 p.a. is about the average expenditure.The larger hedgeless fields suit modern mechanised methods but retain their old names e.g.Clay hill.
